quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: World and Village
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, field, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, how many would be teachers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: In what field is the Golden Duck Award given annually?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Childrens science fiction

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, how many would be non-religious (that is: Atheist, Agnostic, Secular Humanist, No preference)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 171

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, how many would be from the North American continent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 79

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, how many would be doctors?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, how many would speak Hindi as their first language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 101

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, how many would speak English as their first language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 59

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, how many would be in the workforce?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 484

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, how many would be from Asia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 610

questions.question: Of what animal is the legendary Golden Fleece from Greek mythology?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ram

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, how many would own an automobile?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 70

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, what would the life expectancy of the villagers be?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 66

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, how many would speak Mandarin as their first language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 132

questions.question: if the world were a village of 1000 people, how many would be age 65 or older?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 74

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, how many would be from the African continent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 149

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Fear and Village
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, condition, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Bathophobia means fear of taking a bath.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What should one do on examination day in order not to chase away good luck according to Russian superstition?

options.text: One should not cut their nails.
One should not wear anything new.
One should not make their bed.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, what would the per capita income (in USD, Atlas method) of the villagers be?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $7000

questions.question: What word means fear of prostitutes or venereal disease?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cypridophobia

questions.question: What should be done according to a Russian superstition when someone has left the house and gone on a long journey?

options.text: An extra dish is left on the table.
Their radio or TV should not be turned off until they come back.
Their room and their possessions should not be cleaned up until they have arrived.
Their room should be locked up so that nobody would enter.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Their room and their possessions should not be cleaned up until they have arrived.

questions.question: Chiraptophobia means fear of snow.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: If the world were a village of 1000 people, how many acres of land would be in the village?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6000

questions.question: What kind of presents are considered to be taboo according to Russian superstition?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sharp objects

questions.question: There is a Russian tradition of spitting three times to chase away bad luck, similar to knocking on wood. Where should one spit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Over their left shoulder

questions.question: Cancerophobia is a condition characterized by fear of malignant growth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which term means fear of gravity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barophobia

questions.question: Which of these terms means fear of pins and needles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belonephobia

questions.question: Bibliophobia means fear of reading the bible.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What word means fear of newness or novelty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cainophobia

questions.question: Catoptrophobia is defined as fear of mirrors.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Actor and Blood
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, ground. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What will happen if a fork or a spoon falls on the ground according to Russian superstition?

options.text: A male child will be born in the house.
The person who dropped it will have to work very hard.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A female guest will come.

questions.question: Name the actor who starred in the 2007 drama movie There Will Be Blood.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Day-Lewis

questions.question: Why did King Oedipus marry his mother according to the Greek legend?

options.text: To keep their riches withing the family
Because he fell in love with her
He didnt known she was his mother.
Because the gods forced him to do it

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He didnt known she was his mother.

questions.question: If there is a one way street and there are two cars going the opposite direction, is either of the drivers breaking the law?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: What actor starred as mercenary Danny Archer in the 2006 movie Blood Diamond?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonardo DiCaprio

questions.question: What should a stranger say when seeing a baby less that an year old according to Russian tradition?

options.text: They should not speak or smile
May you grow tall and healthy!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oh, what an ugly child!

questions.question: Where shouldnt unmarried people sit if they dont want to stay single for a long time according to Russian superstition?

options.text: At the corner of the table

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: At the corner of the table

questions.question: What is the title of a 1971 Academy Award-nominated movie directed by John Schlesinger?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sunday Bloody Sunday

questions.question: Which of the following movies does not star Will Ferrell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mrs. Doubtfire

questions.question: What does sneezing while talking mean according to Russian superstition?

options.text: The person is telling the truth.
They will be healthy and will live long.
The sneezing person will receive money soon.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The person is telling the truth.

questions.question: How was the FIFA World Cup Won in 2006?

options.text: The winner was decided by the end of the regular time.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: penalty kick shootout

questions.question: What blood song did Michael Jackson release in 1997?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blood on the Dance Floor

questions.question: How is a latecomer punished in Russian traditions?

options.text: They are seated away from the table.
They are not allowed to sit.
They are forced to drink a full glass of alcohol.
They are forbidden to take off their coat.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are forced to drink a full glass of alcohol.

questions.question: What is the name of the first routine that Chazz Michael Michaels and Jimmy MacElroy do together in the movie Blades of Glory?

options.text: Dont Want to Miss a Thing

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fire and Ice

questions.question: What will happen very soon if the cat is washing its face according to Russian beliefs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guests will come.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Palm and People
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, theory. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How are the people having rectangular palms, flushed skin and short fingers classified according to palmistry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fire

questions.question: Which of these is not within the lines of the palm explored by palm readers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Past line

questions.question: What is the Sun line of the human palm associated with in palmistry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fame

questions.question: What position is former Major League Baseball player, Rollie Fingers famous for playing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pitcher

questions.question: What characteristics of the palm are explored by palm readers to predict the future or estimate the personality of its owner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What action star played the lead role in the 1988 movie Bloodsport?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jean-Claude Van Damme

questions.question: According to a theory, palm readers should explore only the left hand of people which of the following people?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Women

questions.question: In what country is the art of palm reading believed to have originated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: India

questions.question: Which line of the palm is traditionally examined first by palm readers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heart line

questions.question: Which WWF group does this theme music belong to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: D-Generation X

questions.question: What classification of the hands do modern palmists most often use to define the personality of the owner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By elements

questions.question: The term cheiromancy, also known as palm reading, is derived from Greek. What does it literally mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hand divination

questions.question: What female musician released the single Red Blooded Woman in 2004?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kylie Minogue

questions.question: What science did Aristotle define as ‘the knowledge of immaterial being’?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Metaphysics

questions.question: Cheirognomy is part of chiromancy, or palm reading. What is the object of its study?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The mounts of the palm

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Position and Player
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, average, ford. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these positions is former baseball player, Dwight Evans most famous for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Right Field

questions.question: Carlton Fisk was a successful Major League Baseball player, who played for 24 years with the Boston Red Sox and Chicago White Sox, in what position?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catcher

questions.question: He is the youngest NBA player to score 10,000 points.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kobe Bryant

questions.question: The Pittsburgh Steelers of the 50s had a third string quarterback from Louisville, who was not making it. They cut him and he landed with the Colts. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Unitas

questions.question: What position is former Major League Baseball player, Joe Morgan most known to have played?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Second Base

questions.question: Baltimore Orioles, Cal Ripken Jr. is most known for playing what position?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shortstop

questions.question: Successful Major League Baseball player and coach, Donald Edward Don Gullett, was famous for playing what position?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pitcher

questions.question: Which was the first football team to win back to back Super Bowls with different coaches?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Francisco

questions.question: He retired with the NBAs highest scoring average (30.1 points per game).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Jordan

questions.question: What position is former baseball player for the Cincinnati Reds, Johnny Bench famous for playing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catcher

questions.question: Whitey Ford was a successful Major League Baseball player, who played in what position?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pitcher

questions.question: What position is former professional baseball player, Mike Schmidt famous for playing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Third Base

questions.question: How many points did Wilt Chamberlain score in his best game versus New York?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 100

questions.question: Steve Garvey is a famous former baseball player, who is known for playing what position?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First Base

questions.question: He is the shortest player ever to win the Slam Dunk Contest.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spud Webb

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Player and Team
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, college, players. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This great sportsman was the first football player to be all-pro at defensive back one year and running back another.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gifford

questions.question: This great running back was once traded for eleven players.  He had great speed and great moves, returned kicks, caught passes, and ran the ball.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ollie Matson

questions.question: His real name is Yelverton Abraham, and he played for San Francisco as well as the NY Giants. He attended LSU.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tittle

questions.question: George Muresan and Manute Bol are the tallest players in NBA history. How tall are they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 77 (2.31m)

questions.question: Who is the shortest player in the history of NBA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tyronne Bogues

questions.question: He was a player, coach, and owner  -all for one team. He was also instrumental in developing the NFL.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Halas

questions.question: This college and pro great had a very strange nickname -Crazy Legs.   His last name was Hirsch.  What was his real first name ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elroy

questions.question: Who is the first player to top 20,000 points in NBA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Pettit

questions.question: This great football player is known for catching the immaculate reception .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franco Harris

questions.question: This great defensive end came from South Carolina State and played for the Rams. He is credited with inventing the head slap move.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Jones

questions.question: This quarterback was cut by the Steelers and picked up by another team, played in high tops, and his teammates include Lenny Moore and Steve Myhra.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Unitas

questions.question: Wilt Chamberlain is a great player indeed. In a game against the Celtics he made the best rebounding effort ever. How many rebounds did he make in this famous game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 55

questions.question: Compton Junior College gave us this all-time great runner, who played fullback and was nicknamed Joe the Jet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Perry

questions.question: Karl Malone received the award Most Valuable Player in 1996-97. What team did he play for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Utah Jazz

questions.question: He is the NBAs All-Time scorer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
